Package game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The main type of the game. It creates and stores links to instances of the game world GameWorld and the player's inventory Inventory. It also creates and stores a list of actions and instances of the actions.
    Version:
    1.0, 2023-06-09
    Author:
    Martin RÅ¯Å¾ek

      Class constructor, creates the game and the set of possible actions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Class constructor, creates the game and the set of possible actions. After the initiation, the game is ready to process commands.

    • Method Detail

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Is game over boolean. Returns true, if game is over; otherwise false. This method is used by ActionTerminate and other implementations of IAction. It doesn't matter if the game is over by winning, losing or by the command 'quit'.
        Returns:
        true, if game is over; otherwise false

      • setGameOver

        public void setGameOver​(boolean gameOver)
        Sets game over.
        Parameters:
        gameOver - value setting the state of the game

      • getWorld

        public GameWorld getWorld()
        Returns link to map of the game world.
        Returns:
        game world

      • getInventory

        public Inventory getInventory()
        Returns link to the player's inventory.
        Returns:
        player's inventory

      • processAction

        public java.lang.String processAction​(java.lang.String action)
        This method processes the command entered by the player. It splits the command into words and tries to find the action with the same name as the first word. If the action is found, it is executed and the result is returned. If the action is not found, the method returns a message about the unknown action.
        Parameters:
        action - text of the command entered by the player
        Returns:
        text returned by the executed action

      • getPrologue

        public java.lang.String getPrologue()
        Returns the prologue of the game.
        Returns:
        the prologue

      • getEpilogue

        public java.lang.String getEpilogue()
        Returns the epilogue of the game.
        Returns:
        the epilogue
